New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his career-high 47th homer.
Shohei Ohtani is continuing his march toward baseball’s first 50-50 season.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani sparked a five-run, six-hit first inning with a 118.1-mph homer.
Tommy Edman hit a two-run homer in the first inning and another two-run shot in the eighth.
Will Smith, Max Muncy, and Tommy Edman hit back-to-back-to-back homers in the first inning.
Ohtani walked and stole his 48th base in the second inning.
Ohtani hit a two-out, two-run single in the third inning.
Cody Bellinger hit a three-run homer for the Cubs in the fifth inning.
Gavin Lux hit a clutch, two-out RBI single in the seventh inning.
Tommy Edman hit his second homer of the game in the eighth inning.
Michael Kopech walked the first three batters in the ninth inning but managed to close the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Dave Roberts commented on the energy and buzz in the dugout during the first inning.
Dave Roberts discussed Shohei Ohtani's potential to win the NL MVP award.
Dave Roberts highlighted Ohtani's unprecedented season and its value to the team.
